- Title: Total Recall (1990) | Plot: A factory worker named Douglas Quaid (played by Mel Gibson), believes that he is a spy and must go to Rekall, a company that offers its clients a chance to experience life as they never could in their real lives. But something strange happens when Douglas Quaid wakes up the next morning after his Rekall experience. The man who he thought was him, turns out to be the man who he spent most of his time with during his real life in the United States of America. Douglas Quaid is shocked by this revelation and must decide whether he should continue living his real-life in the United States of America or start a new life in the United States of America as a spy? The film Total Recall is a science fiction action thriller film directed by Paul Verhoeven, written by William Gibson (novelist) and John W. Minnis (screenwriter)), released on December 14, 1990, in the United States of America through Columbia Pictures, which also distributed it in Europe via Polygraphik.

The movie tells the story of a young girl named San who lives in a forest called Mononoke. San's mother, Hime, is killed by a Tatarigami'': a monster made from the bones and flesh of dead animals. San becomes determined to find out about her mother's death and the creation of the Tatarigami'. She embarks on a journey across different landscapes in order to accomplish this goal.

I would recommend "Dredd", directed by Peter Jackson, based on the comic book series "Dredd" by John Smeal and Martin Nijssen.

The film is set in a futuristic city where the police have the authority to act as judge, jury and executioner.

In this world of violence, the main character, played by Christopher Weir (aka Keanu Reeves), becomes involved in a case involving the theft of the reality-altering drug SLO-MO from the laboratory of Dr. Lidenbrock.
